QAPair.Question: Do you have information about Lipoprotein-a
QAPair.Answer: Lipoproteins are molecules made of proteins and fat. They carry cholesterol and similar substances through the blood. A blood test can be done to measure a specific type of lipoprotein called lipoprotein-a, or Lp(a). A high level of Lp(a) is considered a risk factor for heart disease.
